title: Trump’s Former-Fixer Cohen Says Testimony at Fraud Trial Delayed
description: Donald Trump’s former lawyer and fixer Michael Cohen said he won’t be testifying against his ex-boss in New York state’s civil fraud trial on Tuesday as planned due to a medical conflict.

title: UK Seeks to Ban Baby Wipes That Clog Sewers and Pollute Rivers
description: Plastic wet wipes used for babies and to remove makeup may be banned in the UK under plans to unclog sewers and clean up waterways.

title: As Israel Readies Gaza Invasion, US Sees No Plan for What’s Next
description: President Joe Biden has promised unconditional support for Israel as it gears up for a ground war in the Gaza Strip. But his administration is worried that the Israeli government isn’t ready for the fallout from the massive invasion that could come at any hour.

title: Ron DeSantis Focuses on Trump to Fend Off Nikki Haley’s Ascent
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, clinging to the runner-up spot in the crowded 2024 Republican presidential contest, sought to dismiss the rise of Nikki Haley by reasserting his view of the race as a duel between himself and former President Donald Trump.

title: DC Confronts Its Biggest Obstacle to Downtown Revival: Federal Buildings
description: Washington, DC, Mayor Muriel Bowser says restoring downtown may depend on rethinking federal buildings that are particularly hard to repurpose.

title: US States Buy Israeli Bonds in Show of Support Amid Hamas War
description: Several US states have purchased Israeli bonds as the country enters a war with Hamas and looks to raise funds.

title: Australia’s Indigenous Voice Put to Test in National Vote
description: Australians are voting on Saturday on the proposal to write its Indigenous people into the nation’s constitution, a referendum that polls indicate is likely to be rejected.

title: US House Leaves for the Weekend, Unable to Elect a Speaker
description: House Republicans will call it quits for the week after failing to coalesce around a speaker, leaving the chamber leaderless and unable to do any work.

title: Republican Nomination of Jim Jordan May Not End Speaker Fight
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House and politics reporter Gregory Korte considers what’s next in the speaker saga. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Loyalist Jim Jordan Is Nominated by GOP for House Speaker
description: Republicans nominated Jim Jordan to be speaker of the US House, elevating a conservative firebrand in the fractured party’s second attempt to replace ousted GOP leader Kevin McCarthy.

title: In the Killing Fields Near Gaza, a Child’s Swing Sways in the Ruins
description: Kibbutz Be’eri lost 110 residents in Saturday’s massacre. Those who remain are asking the world to bear witness.

title: In Pictures: A Week of Protests as Israel-Hamas Conflict Rages in Gaza
description: The Oct. 7 raid by Palestinian militants took Israel’s government and intelligence services by surprise. As authorities scrambled to muster a response to the biggest attack in years, the Hamas gunmen who had poured into southern Israel by land, sea and air killed 1,300 Israelis, mostly   unarmed civilians, in several villages, military bases and a desert rave, and took dozens of others hostage.

title: World’s Higher-for-Longer Rate Era Stokes Worry
description: Now that the higher-for-longer interest-rate era has arrived, global finance officials are getting worried about the consequences.

title: The Secret Tunnel Network Complicating Israel’s Gaza Offensive
description: Hamas has used underground passageways to conceal weapons and fighters. Over time, they have become more sophisticated.

title: Yellen Says It’s Critically Important to Contain Middle-East Conflict
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned it is crucial to prevent the war sparked by the Israel-Hamas conflict from becoming a wider, regional conflict.

title: Ecuador Presidential Hopeful Wants Violent Prisoners Put to Sea
description: With Ecuador now under siege by organized crime gangs headquartered in violent prisons, presidential candidate Daniel Noboa is suggesting a centuries-old fix: Move the worst offenders into floating jails.

title: Trauma Over Hostages Shapes Israel's Unflinching Gaza Response
description: Family and friends were ringing Avshalon Haran’s mobile phone for hours on Oct. 7 before a stranger abruptly answered in broken Arabic-accented Hebrew. “Kidnapped, kidnapped, Gaza,’’ the man said. Then the line went dead.

title: Brazil’s Haddad Says Congress Must Do Its Part on Budget Goals
description: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is “optimistic” he will keep his promise to deliver a balanced budget next year, but only if congress does its part to help him zero the primary fiscal deficit, he said in an interview Friday.

title: North Korea Delivered Arms to Russia for Use in Ukraine, US Says
description: The US said North Korea had delivered arms to Russia for use against Ukraine and condemned the move, saying it would further Vladimir Putin’s war and lead to the deaths of more civilians.

title: Saudis Put Israel Normalization on Hold in Blow to US Goals
description: Saudi Arabia has paused diplomacy to normalize ties with Israel amid the violence between Hamas militants and Israeli forces, people familiar with the matter said, in a major blow to President Joe Biden’s ambitions for the Middle East.

title: Congo Election Chief Vows Vote Will Proceed as Planned Despite Intimidation
description: A vote in Democratic Republic of Congo will proceed as scheduled in December despite an armed conflict that’s limited registration in the east and ongoing intimidation of electoral advisers, the country’s top elections official said.

title: A Million Gazans Have Nowhere to Hide From Coming Israeli Troops
description: Israel has warned residents of Gaza City to leave ahead of an expected military offensive to destroy the Hamas militant group behind last Saturday’s attack.

title: Your Guide to Understanding the Roots of the Israel-Hamas War
description: The struggle between Arabs and Jews over ownership of the Holy Land dates back more than a century and has given rise to seven major wars. The latest broke out Oct. 7 when the Islamist Palestinian group Hamas, which is dedicated to Israel’s destruction and which the US and European Union have designated a terrorist organization, attacked southern Israel from the Gaza Strip, killing 1,300 people in towns, kibbutzim, army bases and a music festival in the desert. More than 1,500 people have died i

title: Supreme Court Extends Pause in Biden Social Media Contact Case
description: The US Supreme Court again extended its temporary pause on a lower-court ruling that would restrict the Biden administration’s contacts with social media companies.

title: Putin Says Russia Needs Stronger Ruble to Meet Budget Needs
description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia restored capital controls on major exporters because “we need the ruble a little stronger” for the government’s budget needs.

title: Nigerian President Grants Financial Autonomy to Capital Abuja
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu granted financial autonomy to the capital, Abuja, allowing it to operate similarly to the nation’s 36 states, according to government officials familiar with the decision.

title: Chicago Bets on Events and Hotels to Plug Deficit
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is counting on tourists and residents spending more to have fun, take ride shares and stay in hotels to help plug a half-billion-dollar deficit in next year’s budget.

title: Israeli Poll Shows Netanyahu’s Popularity Drops as Gantz Surges
description: A poll conducted by Israeli research institutes signaled that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s popularity has dropped since Hamas’s devastating attack last weekend, while that of Benny Gantz, a former general who’s now part of Israel’s “war cabinet,” has surged.

title: Biden Can’t Squeeze Iran and Russian Oil at Same Time
description: The US wants to tighten sanctions on Russia and Iran. Doing both at once would carry significant political risks for President Joe Biden as he heads into the 2024 election.

title: Erdogan Says US Support for Kurdish Militants Threatens Turkey
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan accused the US of undermining Turkey’s national security by supporting “terrorists” in Syria as he challenged a White House statement that accused Turkey of hurting American interests in the Middle East.

title: Jim Jordan’s House Speaker Bid Challenged by Austin Scott
description: The Republican race for the US House speakership has become a bitter battle for the future of the GOP between Trumpist hardliners and the party’s establishment.

title: US, EU Will Use Summit to Align Strategies on Russia and China
description: The US and European Union next week will seek progress on a plan to use revenue from frozen Russian assets to pay for Ukraine’s reconstruction.

title: Germany Gets Tough on EU Debt Rules, Warns Markets Will Judge Harshly
description: German officials toughened their stance as negotiations over European debt and deficit rules enter the final strait, warning that a toothless agreement would be judged harshly by bond investors.

title: Egypt Plans to Start Hedging Its Wheat Purchases Next Year
description: Egypt plans to hedge against global wheat price increases next year, Finance Minister Mohamed Maait said.

title: Switzerland Says It’s Confident Hamas Not Using Nation’s Banks
description: The Swiss government is confident that Hamas is not using the country’s banks, given the widespread condemnation of the group as a terrorist organization.

title: US Working to Establish Safe Areas in Gaza as Conflict Escalates
description: The US is working with the United Nations and other international relief agencies to establish safe areas within Gaza for Palestinian civilians as Israel ramps up retaliatory strikes following attacks by Hamas, a senior State Department official said Friday.

title: Senegal Appeals Ruling on Opposition Chief Running for President
description: Senegalese opposition leader Ousmane Sonko is back in the presidential race after a court annulled a ruling that would have prevented him from running.

title: The Winners and Losers From Malaysia’s 2024 Spending Plan
description: Malaysia unveiled a smaller 393.8 billion ringgit ($83.3 billion) spending plan on Friday as the country aims to reduce its budget deficit in 2024 and boost investor confidence with its fiscal discipline.

title: Game On For The UK?
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Sweden Has Done Its Part on NATO Bid, Premier Says
description: Sweden’s Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson said there are no outstanding demands on his country from Turkey to secure the ratification of its entry bid for the NATO defense alliance, expecting the move to happen “relatively soon.”

title: Farage Says He’s Opened Lloyds Account After NatWest Controversy
description: Nigel Farage says he has moved his personal banking account to Lloyds Banking Group Plc, the latest milestone in the debanking controversy.

title: Protests Erupt Across Mideast as Israel Prepares Gaza Assault
description: Thousands of anti-Israeli protesters took to the streets across the Middle East on Friday, as Israel stepped up preparations for a ground assault on Gaza and Palestinian militant group Hamas called for a ‘Day of Rage.’

title: Czechs Approve $6.4 Billion Package of Tax Hikes and Spending Cuts
description: Czech lawmakers approved a plan to raise taxes and cut spending as the government seeks to slash the budget deficit even as households struggle to recover from the worst cost-of-living crisis in three decades.

title: France High School Knife Attack Leaves One Dead: AFP
description: A teacher was killed during a knife attack at a high school in Arras, in northern France, Agence France-Presse reported.

title: War, Trade and Weather Turn Food Into Political Issue
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Hostile Nations Behind Bomb Threats at Schools in Baltics, Lithuania Says
description: Hundreds of schools across Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania have received bomb threats, in what the Lithuanian government said was “a likely targeted attack from hostile nations” in the Baltic region.

title: UK and EU Nearing Deal to Delay Post-Brexit EV Tariffs
description: The UK and European Union are getting closer to an agreement that could delay the introduction of post-Brexit tariffs on electric vehicles.

title: IMF Will Review Kenya Program in November to Unlock Funding
description: An International Monetary Fund mission is expected in Kenya in early November to review the nation’s ongoing program, as the East Africa nation’s authorities look to raise funds to repay a $2 billion eurobond due June 2024.

title: IMF Latest: World Bank Says Poorest Need More Funding Than Ever
description: World Bank President Ajay Banga urged the lender’s members to make record contributions in the next funding round for its arm that helps the 75 poorest nations, warning of declining progress in the fight against poverty.

title: EU’s Top Diplomat Says Trust With China ‘Eroded’ Over Ukraine
description: The European Union’s top diplomat said trust with China had “eroded” over Beijing’s stance on the war in Ukraine and warned that more trade imbalances with the world’s second-biggest economy would lead to expanded protectionism.

title: German Finance Minister Pushes Back Against Economic Prophets of “Doom”
description: Germany is doing everything it can to bolster its struggling economy and prevent it from becoming the “sick man” of Europe, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.

title: Biden’s Backing of Israel Is Personal But Also Helps His Party
description: President Joe Biden’s strong support for Israel is one of his most deeply held beliefs, dating back to his childhood. It also may pay political dividends as he ramps up his reelection bid.

title: French Lawmakers Seek to Extend Windfall Taxes on Oil and Power
description: French lawmakers are seeking to extend windfall taxes on the profits of oil refiners and utilities into next year.

title: Ukraine Recap: Kyiv Counters Major Russian Assault on Avdiivka
description: Russia’s assault on the town of Avdiivka in the eastern Donetsk region has been repelled so far, with more than 20 attacks in the vicinity countered over the past day, Kyiv’s General Staff said on Facebook. Russia has captured about 4.5 square kilometers (1.7 square miles) around Avdiivka since Tuesday without securing “major breakthroughs,” said US-based military analysts at the Institute for the Study of War. Russia’s “exact objectives” in its offensive there remain unclear, ISW said.

title: North Korea Threatens US for Sending Aircraft Carrier to South
description: North Korea warned it’s ready to use its most powerful weapons in a strike after the US deployed an aircraft carrier group to South Korea, signaling a provocation while the Biden administration is occupied with the Middle East conflict.

title: Iran Says New Front Possible If ‘Israeli War Crimes’ Continue
description: Iran-backed militants could open a new front in Israel’s war against Hamas if the blockade of Gaza and “war crimes” there continue, Iran’s Foreign Minister said, signaling a potential expansion of the conflict.

title: Israel Latest: IDF Urges Evacuation of Gaza City, Signaling Incursion
description: Israel called for an evacuation of all civilians in Gaza City and told the United Nations to move its staff away from nearby areas, indicating a ground operation could be coming soon. The UN said the Israeli military gave 24 hours for the evacuation.

title: UN Calls Israel Order to Evacuate 1.1 Million in Gaza Impossible
description: The United Nations said Israel called for the evacuation of 1.1 million people living in northern Gaza within the next 24 hours, describing the order as “impossible” and appealing for a reversal ahead of what increasingly looks like an imminent ground invasion.

title: Wars, Trade Bans and Climate Change Turn Food Into Politics
description: Protecting consumers and farmers is a frontline campaign issue in elections across the world. We look at some key countries.

title: US Extends TSMC’s Waiver for Advanced Chipmaking Gear in China
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. has received an extension to its exemption from US trade sanctions on China, allowing it to continue acquiring advanced chip equipment for its operations there, according to a senior Taiwanese official.

title: Japan Asks Court to Dissolve Church Cited in Abe Shooting
description: Japan’s government asked a court to order the dissolution of a fringe religious group whose activities were cited as motivation in the fatal shooting of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe last year.

title: Scalise Drops Out of US House Speaker Race, Adding More Chaos
description: Representative Steve Scalise abandoned his short-lived campaign Thursday to become US House speaker following days of contentious meetings among fellow Republicans.
